content.description:
Sit Start on opposing slopers, slap your way through more slopers, pinches and crimps trending right and finishing on the technical highball slab.

 Video Beta: https://vimeo.com/183608239
content.location: Follow the main trail for Red Dragon, cut off to the left 200' below the cliff. This enormous boulder is slightly hidden by the trees.

content.description: Start from an obvious crimp rail with a huge foot rail. Traverse the sloper rail trending to the left. The crux is about 12' off the deck utilizing a gaston to gain a bomber hand jam; finishing on large pockets on a water streaked slab. Sidenote: The downclimb off this boulder is the only drawback of this awesome problem. It can be rapped of a large tree (what I did) or the hike up and around is long in climbing shoes.
content.location: Can't miss it on the right side of the trail up to Red Dragon.

climbs.name: Corn on the Cob
climbs.fa: Ethan Dyer Stand // D Mauz Sit

content.description: Start low bear hugging the right arÃªte on opposing crimps. Make a few tricky moves to gain a huge hueco, traverse left through jugs and an airy finish. Landing is not great. You can stand start off the slab on juggy huecos making the problem a bit more enjoyable and much easier... maybe V1.
content.location: Can't miss it following the trail to Red Dragon.

content.description: Several decent boulders right along the trail to Red Dragon.
